name: Uwaa
description:
Uwaa is a game about instructions and robots; make instructions for a small robot to complete a level you don't have access to, by using magical instruction-blocks! Uwwa is a puzzle game; but, if you put enough thought into it, you can solve any level, even if you are not good at puzzles!

You can think of making instructions for the robot as making GPS instructions. You tell the robot to go left, right, up, use the thing right next it, or wait a turn!

Additionally, Uwwa teaches you the very basics of programming. Don't expect anything slightly more complicated than "move right", though.

~~ HOW TO PLAY ~~

Your objective is to build proper instructions for the robot, so that they will use the blue lever (that is present in every level). Use P to see what obstacles the robot should pass. Put the blocks, in order, on the sequencer (the vertical line), to make the robot follow them.

You are 100% allowed to share your level-code with others in the comment section!

~~ Features: ~~

  • Engaging robot-puzzle-action!
  • A level editor/loader!
  • A retro pixel-art artstyle!
  • You can operate a robot to do work for you!
  • Full, original (and calming) soundtrack!
  • Did I mention that you can operate a robot?

~~ Controls: ~~

WSAD or arrow keys: Move

R: Restart current level

Q or P: Preview robot area (toggleable)

Z or [ENTER]: Execute instruction sequence (go to execute-mode)

X: Exit instruction sequence (go back to build-mode)

[ESC] (Escape): Exit to main-menu

..:: The best level-codes will be featured here! ::..
